results.title: The Symphony orchestra
results.brief_description: The composer who creates symphonic music must still rely on the efforts of many other musicians for a performance of his work; and the conductor of the orchestra which is to perform a symphonic work is largely responsible for the interpretation placed on the work of the composer whose work they are to play. In this film, the function of the various choirs of the orchestra is demonstrated, as Howard Barlow conducts the Columbia Symphony Orchestra in a performance of Wagner’s “Ride of the Valkyries” and the Prelude to Act III of “Lohengrin”.

results.title: The Symphonie experiment: a report
results.creator_credit: Unesco and French Telecommunication Research Center
results.brief_description: 36,000 kilometres above the Equator, the French/German satellite ‘Symphonie’ circles the earth. The two governments offered their satellite to UNESCO on an experimental basis for its 19th General Conference, held at Nairobi, Kenya. The film details the facilities made available, and the consequent benefits to UNESCO and the world.

results.title: The Sydney Opera House Tenth Anniversary Recital: Roger Woodward
results.creator_credit: Yoho Productions, Peter Abbott and Peter Skillman
results.brief_description: Roper Woodward played the first recital at the Sydney Opera House in 1973 and ten years later he was given the honour of performing the tenth anniversary recital on October 1, 1983. This video presents Roger Woodward performing the commemorative tenth recital live at the Sydney Opera House playing three of Beethoven’s sonatas and ending with an encore of Chopin’s Grand Waltz.

results.title: The Sydney Dance Company in Daphnis & Chloe
results.creator_credit: Independent Film Channel (US), Channel 4 Television Corporation, Charles Thompson and Jolyon Wimhurst
results.brief_description: The program opens with the choreographer, Graeme Murphy, discussing the origins of the work and how he changed it, illustrated with extracts from the performance which follows. The performance opens in a garden which is overseen by the God Pan. Innocent Daphnis falls for Chloe, but he has a rival, Dorcan the Herdsmen. They vie for her hand in a dance competition; the winner to receive a kiss.

results.title: The Sword of the lord
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Desmond Dew and Giles Walker
results.brief_description: This film records the extraordinary determination of Jungle Jim Hunter to be the best ski racer in the world. We witness the gruelling exercise routines, the pre-race tensions, the descents, the disappointments and the deep religious faith of this most dedicated athlete. Photographed by Paul Cowan. Edited by John Laing. Music by Ben Low. Sound by Bev Davidson, Andre Galbrand.

results.title: The Sword in the Stone
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: A wondrous golden sword embedded in a large stone offers a tempting challenge to the strongest and bravest men in the kingdom - remove the sword and become the next king of England! When one small boy dares to accept the challenge, he unleashes a series of awesome miracles and incredible battles between the wizards in England. With glorious animation and delightful songs, this story is a Walt Disney classic.

results.title: The Switchboard operator = Ljubavni Slucaj, trafedija sluzbenice PTT
results.brief_description: Makavejev’s second feature tells the story of a love affair between Izabela, a liberated young woman from the Hungarian minority in Yugoslavia, and the more conventional Ahmed, who is a member of the Moslem community. Gradually their cultural differences become a source of conflict. Rather than telling their story through a linear narrative, Makavejev introduces apparently extraneous documentary elements, building up a complex and richly allusive collage of a society undergoing a process of rapid and bewildering social change. The film provides an insight into the internal tensions which contributed to the eventual break-up of the former Yugoslavia. In Serbo-Croatian language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Swingle singers
results.brief_description: A group of eight singers from Paris under the direction of American Ward Swingle, sing music by Bach in jazz idiom, accompanied by two musicians on bass and drums.

results.title: The Swineherd (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Paul Hammerich and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A spoiled princess scorns the love of a worthy prince yet will kiss a swineherd a hundred times for a silly musical toy. An adaptation of the Hans Christian Andersen story that uses original illustrations from the book by Bjorn Wiinblad. Interesting animation by Gene Deitch with touches of irony in narration. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
